Name of Indicator: Preoperative chest radiography in the absence of a clinical suspicion for intrathoracic pathology
Motivator: Motivator: this is of little clinical value and leads to cascades of harm
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: use of preoperative chest xray in people without symptoms or history of lung disease
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with the Inclusionary diagnsosis code(same claim) with NO exclusionary diagnosis codes within 180 days preceding procedure code
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Motivator: Motivator: Ottowa rules work very well.  Where they do not apply, plain film radiography is the first appropriate study.
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: Use of any imaging ASIDE from plain radiography in the setting of acute foot trauma (i.e. CT, MRI)
Operational Considerations: Inclusionary diagnosis on the same claim as the CPT code and no exclusionary code (same code) in the preceding 30 days, restrict to age over 5 years

Name of Indicator: MRI in individuals with mild traumatic brain injury
Motivator: Motivator:  patients with mild TBI are unlikely to have a brain hemorrhage
Indicators in Prose: Indicator:  brain MRI in individuals presenting with mild TBI
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with the inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim) seen in an ED or outpatient setting; NOT APPLICABLE TO INPATIENTS

Name of Indicator: Don’t order sinus computed tomography (CT) for uncomplicated acute rhinosinusitis.
Motivator: Motivator: sinus CT adds little information that will change management of acute sinusitis
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: Sinus CT in patients with acute sinusitis without a history of chronic sinusitis
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with an inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim)  AND  no exclusionary diagnosis code in preceding 180 days

Name of Indicator: Abdomen CT use of contrast material (w and w/o)
Motivator: Motivator: If one has the results of an abdominal CT with contrast, there is no added information on doing and billing for one without contrast
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: abdominal CTs on the same day with and without contrast
Operational Considerations: ICD-10-PCS codes or  CPT code (w and without)   OR  CPT code for w/ and CPT for w/o on same day

Name of Indicator: MRI Lumbar Spine for Low Back Pain
Motivator: Motivator: MRI’s are used too early and too often for mechanical low back pain; they are only indicated when there are red flags or radicular symptoms where there might be need for intervention
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: MRI for lumbar spine in the absence of red flag conditions or in the absence of neuropathy as known from radicular pain or lower extremity weakness.
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with inclusionary code  (same claim) AND absence of exclusionary codes in preceding 60 days

Motivator: Motivator: traction has little evidence base for low back pain treatment.
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: use of traction among patients with low back pain
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with with inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim)

Motivator: Motivator: there are too many hysterectomies performed for benign disease that could be managed more conservatively
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: Hysterectomy performed for an indication other than a cancer diagnosis of a pelvic organ (ovary, uterus, peritoneum, cervix, bladder).
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is NOT associated with an exclusionary diagnosis code (same claim).

Motivator: Motivator: there are too many lumbar laminectomies done for back pain; they largely should never happen except for radicular pain or weakness.
Indicators in Prose: Indicator:   Lumbar laminectomy or spinal fusion in the absence of neuropathy as known from radicular pain or lower extremity weakness.
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with NO exclusionary diagnosis within preceding 60 days

Name of Indicator: Meniscectomy in patients with DJD of the knee
Motivator: Motivator: partial meniscectomy or meniscus repair or placement of an artificial meniscus have little value in patients with DJD of the knee
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: use of meniscectomy in a population of patients with DJD
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with inclusionary diagnosis code in preceding 60 days and with NO exclusionary code on associated with the procedure (same claim).

Motivator: Motivator:  patients with acute sinusitis should not be rushed to nasal endoscopy; this would only be indicated for chronic sinusitis
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: Nasal endoscopy in patients with acute sinusitis without a history of chronic sinusitis
Operational Considerations: Inclusionary diagnosis code is associated with the procedure code (same claim)  AND  no exclusionary diagnosis code in preceding 180 days
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Name of Indicator: Use of routine cervical cytology (Pap tests) in women over 65 years
Motivator: Motivator: there is no reduction in morbidity and mortality with cervical cancer screening in women at low risk of cervical cancer
Indicators in Prose: Indicator:  PAP smears seen in consecutive years among women over 65 years AND diagnosis of screening
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim) and person is 65 years or older
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Name of Indicator: Screening mammography in women 85 years and older
Motivator: Motivator: women over age 85 have slowly growing cancers and do not benefit form screening given short life expectancy
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: mammography in women 85 years and older AND a diagnosis of screening for breast cancer
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim) and person is 85 years or older
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Name of Indicator: Screening for colorectal cancer in adults 80 years and older
Motivator: Motivator: patients with expected longevity of less than 10 years do not benefit from screening for colon cancer
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: colonoscopy, sigmoidoscopy, with the indication of screening in patients above age 80 years AND a diagnosis of colon cancer screening
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim) AND person is 80 years or above
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Name of Indicator: Screening for asymptomatic carotid artery stenosis (CAS) in individuals over age 80 years
Motivator: Motivator: screening asymptomatic patients has not been demonstrated to prevent stroke
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: use of coronary artery ultrasonography in people without symptoms attributable to coronary artery stenosis (largely stroke or TIA)
Operational Considerations: Procedure code with no exclusionary diagnosis within preceding 180 days
Setting of Indicator Event: Outpatient only; No inpatient and no ED

Name of Indicator: Routine monitoring of digoxin in patients with congestive heart failure
Motivator: Motivator: digoxin monitoring should not be done routinely; it should only be done if there is concern about digoxin toxicity
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with the inclusionarey diagnosis cade (same claim) and exclusionary diagnosis code is NOT associated with the procedure code (same claim)

Name of Indicator: EEG monitoring in individuals presenting with syncope
Motivator: Motivator: this seldom yields a diagnosis of seizures in this population
Indicators in Prose: Indicator: EEG monitoring during the hospitalization or observation unit stay of a patient with a diagnosis of syncope
Operational Considerations: Procedure code is associated with an inclusionary diagnosis code (same claim) or same admission (with  diagnosis)
